intro: Oxytropis jabalambrensis, commonly known as the Jabal Ambra oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of North Africa, particularly in Morocco and Algeria. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis jabalambrensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
